attributes.action: Remove the charge for calling 101 non police emergency.
attributes.background: We shouldn't be charged 15 pence for calling 101, when calling 999 is free.

attributes.action: Introduction of Mental Health into National Curriculum and Hospitals
attributes.background:
We truly believe that more needs to be done in relation to suicide.

There should be no stigma attached to Mental Health and the only way to eradicate a stigma surrounding a 'taboo' subject is to educate by bringing it into National Curriculum and more information/care available in hospitals.
attributes.additional_details:
6581 committed suicide in 2014 alone, each and everyone of those people had a family, friends and countless people that would have been touched by their passing.
We passionately believe that the rates of suicide would decrease if Mental Health was part of the National Curriculum and the younger generation were aware of what symptoms to look out for in themselves and those around them
With that we also believe that there's room for improvement with information and Mental Health care in hospitals

attributes.action: Make ALL schools teach kids the dangers of the railway.
attributes.background:
We all know that the railway is a dangerous place, however people still do not understand this and are running across the tracks at stations, laying on the tracks or even playing chicken at level crossings.

Last year 332 people died after trespassing onto the railway tracks in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Now kids think it's right to play on the railway and ignore all the safety rules displayed around the tracks. 

If schools teach kids that it's dangerous to play on or around the railway then the figures might go down and there will be less deaths.

attributes.action: Criminalise the act of impersonating serving military personnel or veterans
attributes.background:
It is getting common recently for civilians to impersonate military service men/women by claiming they are serving or are veterans.

This causes great distress to many veterans and families and is a blatant disregard.

The Stolen Valor Act 2005 has to a great degree mitigated this in the USA.

attributes.action: The Abolition of the Monarchy to be in effect as soon as possible
attributes.background:
We the undersigned, want to abolish the Monarchy due to many reasons.

Mainly due to them being out of touch with the majority of the public in the 21st Century, their unaccountability and constantly showing us how unequal we are in this country we call a democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
The Monarchy still retains a lot of political power for an establishment that is unelected, being able to influence our laws on a daily basis, this is well known.
The Monarch retains the powers to appoint and dismiss Prime Ministers that we elect by a democratic majority whenever they choose, the last time this happened was in 1974.
Officially, we are subjects and not citizens of this country from the day we are born.
Also, we spend far too much on the Monarchy, this money could be spent better.

attributes.action: Start an domestic abuse register
attributes.background: This will enable you to find out if your new partner has ever been charged or suspected of domestic abuse offences and enable you to check court records for non molestation orders issued against them. Domestic abuse is growing and this register would empower the individual to protect themselves

attributes.action: Cut off all ties with Iran and cancel our part in the terrible deal immediately
attributes.background: The deal is a bad one, as everyone knows. It allows Iran to obtain nuclear weapons and missiles even quicker, thus endangering the security of Israel and the rest of the world. We want an end to this shameful and dangerous mistake at once.
attributes.additional_details: Obama lied about the deal as everyone knows.His clueless foreign policy is just to gain him anything of a legacy but he clearly understands nothing about the roots of terror and cares nothing about Israel's security. But our government should know better than to always bow to Obama. Phillip Hammond made a fool out of himself by trying to deny Iran wants to destroy Israel. Tony Blair and Gordon Brown would never have signed this deal and the Tories dare to claim they are more pro-Israel than them

attributes.action: Stop cataract eye operations being rationed for the elderly ..
attributes.background: it is a fact that hospitals are restricting people from having cataract operations, to save money,  yet they only cost £800-00 and take about 30 mins. A lot of them would pay the £800-00  to help with the cost ,but cant afford around £3000-00.

attributes.action: Add safeguards to §111A (Enterprise & Regulatory Reform Act 2013) for employees.
attributes.background:
The current laws regarding 'Settlement Agreements' or 'Without Prejudice Conversations' or 'Protected Conversations' or 'Off the record Conversations' are shockingly lacking in safeguards for the employee.

They can be sprung upon an employee as a way of getting rid of them without red tape.
attributes.additional_details:
They are being used currently by employers as a way to place 'no other options decisions' on the employee and there is not enough safeguarding process to resolve relationship issues through other steps first. Much like you can't go to tribunal without a certificate from ACAS, employers should not be allowed to have these types of conversation without all possible other avenues exhausted first.

I'm not suggesting that the option shouldn't be there, it should just be limited to the final ones.

attributes.action: A government review into the feasibility of driverless trains within the UK
attributes.background: We request a government led industry review, working with all train operators/ management and unions into the feasibility of driverless trains in the UK. The current approach where millions of the population are constrained by the availability of train drivers (sickness or strike) is not acceptable
attributes.additional_details:
Driverless technology is being adopted across the car industry (e.g. Google, Nissan and Tesla). This technology on complex, multi vehicle transport routes. 
https://www.cbinsights.com/blog/autonomous-driverless-vehicles-corporations-list/

attributes.action: Introduce motorcycle licence progression training as per the 3rd EU Directive.
attributes.background: Department of Transport ignored the licence progression training in Article 7.1.c of 3rd EU Driving Licence Directive. It imposed compulsory retesting which removed all incentive for novices to train and qualify for A1. There was an 8% increase in Killed & Seriously Injured 'after' implementation.
attributes.additional_details: 17-19 year olds can ride A1 class bikes (125cc) on a CBT cert. At 19 they can take the A2 test for larger bikes. There is now no incentive to train to A1 test standard because they are forced to repeat the same tests when they are entitled to progress at 19. This essentially entices them to wait and continue on a CBT. They ride for up to 2 years without any highway code knowledge, theory test and hazard perception. CBT only gives them 2 hours road preparation. DVSA stats show a 8% KSI increase.

attributes.action: Force Manufacturers of all goods to make warranties transferable.
attributes.background: I wanted to buy a lens that's only 4 months old. The maker told me that the 12 month warranty isn't transferable and applies to the original purchaser only.  Common with consumer goods. I think they should simply have to guarantee the product for a period of time regardless of changes in ownership.

attributes.action: Ban, male only,  gender segregated, activities in all UK  sports facilities.
attributes.background: Women are BANNED from 'men-only' sessions at Luton's taxpayer-funded Olympic swimming pool 'for cultural reasons' and segregated in smaller community baths and segregated in smaller community baths.
attributes.additional_details: Women are BANNED from 'men-only' sessions at Luton's taxpayer-funded Olympic swimming pool 'for cultural reasons' and segregated in smaller community baths.

attributes.action: We the 17.5 million Brexit Supporters demand a general election immediately
attributes.background: Teresa May is stalling the process, meeting with Brussels, Angela Merkel and The First Minister of Scotland, and Is also allowing unelected peers to try and block Brexit, she is not honouring her pledge that Brexit means Brexit, she was not elected by the people of the UK

attributes.action: Government to fund a program to help local councils to house the homeless.
attributes.background: When you walk through any city, today you will see numerous homeless people, many of us have probably looked down at them as wasters but if you stop, sit and talk to them you will realise that misguided. The time for action is now, Government needs to give the councils the money to help the homeless
attributes.additional_details: They are from all walks of life but have one thing in common down on luck. I have started siting down and talking to some who I see reguarly over the last year or so. From the ex-soldier with no where to go, to the college student who had quit her course when she became homeless. All tell the same story, living on sofas, looking for a job, 1 night on the street turns into 2 which before long is 367.

attributes.action: Reform of the UK's honours system, reflecting achievement, not money donated.
attributes.background:
The honours system has become discredited to the point that highest bidders win high honours, irrespective of their achievements and merit to the country.

Honours should only be given for real, tangible, honourable acts or achievements - not for political donations or doing a Whitehall job.
attributes.additional_details:
It seems incredulous that people are given knighthoods for doing Whitehall jobs they have been handsomely paid for anyway, yet doctors, nurses, consultants, teachers, firefighters, police etc all struggle to get recognition for saving lives and transforming society.

Handing honours to people who have helped individuals achieve office by money or political manoeuvring is sheer cronyism; the current system must now be overhauled to stop its dishonourable use and restore its proper status.

attributes.action: Make a UK-wide ban on the use of artifical colourings in medication.
attributes.background:
Artifical colouring agents are often unnecessarily used in medication to effect a particular appearance rather than for any significant gain or change in the effectiveness of medications. 
As one of many people prone to allergic reactions to colourings E102-E133 I request a ban from medication use.
attributes.additional_details:
Artifical colourings can make it greatly difficult for those sensetive to find even basic medication without adverse effects.  Examples of which are calcium supplements containing brilliant blue E133 and antibiotics such as amoxicillin containing sunset yellow E110

Reactions in those allergic can range from migraines and photosensitivity,  hypersensitivity,  vomiting & in my personal experience with E133 rash,  nausea, swelling of throat and disorientation. These are unacceptable & unnecessary

attributes.action: Drivers over 60 to take a mini driving test
attributes.background: Drivers over the age of 60 to take a mini test, due to them having slow reaction times .
attributes.additional_details: As we age, we slow down. I think that drivers over the age of 60 should have to take a mini test. There are way to many old drivers causing accidents due to due care and attention.A mini test every five years would lesson the amount of accidents caused by people over 60.

attributes.action: Make GPs stop giving out prescriptions for over the counter painkillers
attributes.background: In 2015 the NHS spent 87 million pound on prescriptions for paracetemol alone aswell as 27 million on ibruprofen. These are medication that can be purchased for 20p in any shop imagine the money the NHS could save and how many urgent operations could be made with the money that will be saved.

attributes.action: Levy £1.00 tax on non recyclable coffee cups and give proceeds to NHS.
attributes.background: Britain throws away 2 500 000 000 coffee cups a year which cannot be recycled. The technology exists to make them recyclable. This tax will make it an economic necessity for the BIG coffee companies to act.
attributes.additional_details: Reference BBC1 program presented by Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall "War on waste" 21:00 July 28 2016.

attributes.action: Stop doctors charging for signing cremation form
attributes.background: £168 for a dr to sign cremation form

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all school children to learn sign language.
attributes.background: Personally, I feel like sign language should be something everyone should know. Im not deaf nor do I know anyone who is but I can easily empathise with the deaf community and can understand that a world where most people are unable to communicate with you must be rather terrifying.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.actiononhearingloss.org.uk/your-hearing/ways-of-communicating/british-sign-language-bsl.aspx

attributes.action: Stop self employed people paying tax in advance as paye do not pay in advance
attributes.background: As self employed individual I pay tax in advance and really struggle to do so .I am a self employed electrician ,I have good years and bad years so when the HMRC asked for money in advance , I really struggle to pay it ,this is unfair as when I was a paye they never asked for 6 month tax ahead
attributes.additional_details:
If I should fall short of money ,example people paying me late . Then I have to pay interest on tax money I should be paying in advance to the HMRC. 
I believe this system makes many small individuals and small company's go out of business. 
Let's to be fair to all who work paye and self employed people

attributes.action: Bypass BREXIT but work for EU reform to allow UK border immigration control
attributes.background: Parliament is a representative democracy but should urgently respond to the disquiet over immigration expressed in the referendum. The implications of BREXIT are potentially horrendous for both the UK and EU and it is critical not to terminate, but to reformulate our membership.
attributes.additional_details: The  Referendum, widely recognized to have flawed origins and severely compromised by misinformation, should be considered accordingly. There are now new opportunities first to renegotiate our relationship with the EU regarding border control, and then work to improve structures with democratic processes, openness and transparency at its heart.

attributes.action: Only allow supermarkets to have ONE isle for junk food (eg crisps and sweets)
attributes.background: Junk food is bad for us and causes many health problems so we need to cut down on the amount of junk foods avalible in shops. One way of doing this is instead of having one isle for chocolate and sweets in the supermarket and another for crisps only- we have one isle for them all.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.nhs.uk/livewell/goodfood/pages/sugars.aspx

attributes.action: Make all fuel stations / garage forecourts give free air and water.
attributes.background: It is a legal requirement to keep tyres inflated at the correct pressure and to have a clear visible view of the road. Stop making  people have to pay to keep there car legal on the road! Some garages already give free air and water. It's just more revenue for the fuel companies.

attributes.action: Make  verbal abuse of teachers by students and parents an offense like the NHS
attributes.background: Teachers need respect given to them to ensure that they can perform well in the classroom. Often behaviour policies in schools are so varied that students, parents and carers in some cases seem to get away without any consequences to verbal abuse of the teacher.
attributes.additional_details: This is a stop verbal abuse of teachers campaign.

attributes.action: Ban and prevent the sale of Microtransactions and DlC in games and apps.
attributes.background: Corporations within the gaming , mobile and software industry have become to big and greedy. Exploiting consumers for all of their money and making 100% profit from Microtransactions. Often making money off non existent things such as virtual currency. Also protecting people who have massive bills.
attributes.additional_details:
http://venturebeat.com/2014/02/21/report-finds-free-to-play-microtransactions-make-up-79-of-u-s-app-store-revenues/ 

http://www.moneysavingexpert.com/news/phones/2013/02/kids-spent-3200-iphone-avoid-app-charge-hell 

http://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/2016-03-02-eas-ultimate-team-earning-around-usd650-million-a-year 

http://uk.businessinsider.com/microtransactions-are-ruining-video-games-2015-4

attributes.action: Ban barbeque's within built up and residential areas in the UK
attributes.background: I find it extremely offensive to have to breath in smoke of any kind bellowing from a neighbors garden.The smell gets into my laundry that I hang outside and also my upholstery/bedding. It stinks my entire home out which also means theres no chance that I can enjoy an evening in my own garden.
attributes.additional_details: I haven't eaten meat for 27 years so I am fully evolved and for that reason barbeque's are extremely offensive to someone like myself and why should I have to put of with this smell in my home?Even if I wasn't a Vegan I would still find smoke bellowing through my home unacceptable.Please help me to ban barbecues within built up and residential areas in the UK

attributes.action: Stop the banks from creating money from commecial debt, ending boom and bust.
attributes.background: The creation of commecial money from the inflationary act of creating money from debt is responsible for the boom and bust cycles. We need to end the fractional reserve banking where banks are allowed to lend money that they do not have, gaining purchasing power and interest from money they created.
attributes.additional_details:
http://positivemoney.org/videos/97-owned-monetary-reform-documentary/

http://www.investopedia.com/terms/f/fractionalreservebanking.asp

http://positivemoney.org/2011/09/fractional-reserve-banking-leads-booms-busts/

attributes.action: Increase the number of Armed Police to deal with the growing security threat.
attributes.background: UK police forces are poorly equipped to deal with the current terrorist threat. A Nice, Orlando or Paris style attack in a UK city would see Police running for cover while they await the arrival of Armed Response units who could be tens of minutes away. Rural towns are especially vulnerable.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK is a highly likely target for an imminent terrorist attack. Our current threat level is "SEVERE" which means, "an attack is highly likely"

One person with an AK47 can fire 100s of rounds within just 1 minute.

The public & our Police Officers need protecting NOW rather than waiting for the next attack & reviewing how many lives could have been saved. More Armed Police would also act as a deterrent.

Armed officers should wear body cams to back up justification of any use of a firearm.

attributes.action: Stop the rise of youth crime- introduce harsher punishments as a deterrent.
attributes.background: As young people we think youth crime is a problem and more needs to be done about it. We think there should be harsher punishments, especially for repeated offenders as it is unfair all young people and teenagers are labeled 'thugs'.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the Daily Mail, under 18s commit a quarter of all crimes.

Statistics on www.gov.uk show that in 2013/14 there were 90,769 offences which resulted in a disposal, and the most common offence was violence against the person.

attributes.action: Increase the UK's military response against ISIS
attributes.background: The UK has been a part of a US-led coalition against ISIS for nearly two years. In that time period terrorist attacks around the world and against our allies have increased dramatically. We must increase our military efforts to ensure our safety and the safety of our allies by destroying ISIS.
attributes.additional_details: The death toll from ISIS terrorist attacks was 9 in 2013, increased to 1,020 in 2015 and is currently at 840 in 2016 after the horrific attack in Nice. The numbers of attacks continue to increase and ISIS continue to target some of our greatest allies such as Belgium, France and the United States. We must increase our efforts against ISIS to ensure that we are safe from terrorist attacks and to ensure the freedoms we hold so dear are protected.

attributes.action: Bar anyone who's used racist epithets/insulted foreign dignitaries from Cabinet.
attributes.background: A Minister of the Crown must be a fit and proper person, and Parliament should have the power to reject the appointment to Cabinet of someone who has used racist language or whose presence in government would impair Britain's diplomatic relations due to their having insulted foreign dignitaries.

attributes.action: Set up  a legally binding code of conduct/ethics for insurance companies.
attributes.background: Currently it is completely legal for insurers to deliberately use delaying tactics when dealing with no fault insurance claims.  Make it illegal to delay claims by constantly changing case handlers, refusing to acknowledge communication and simply stalling just  to name a few.

attributes.action: Maintain Freedom of Movement within EU countries that currently have the Euro.
attributes.background: As most countries with the Euro have economies similar to our own I feel this would help reduce low-skilled immigration while maintaining freedoms for those UK citizens who wish to live and work in Europe. I believe this would represent both sides of the recent referendum vote.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.migrationwatchuk.org/statistics-net-migration-statistics

As you will see from the link more people entered the UK from Non-EU countries 277,000 than EU countries 270,000. If you select the EU8 and EU2 options you see that the countries without the Euro make up 160,000 of the total amount of EU immigration. Therefore negotiating a situation that maintains Free Movement of Workers with countries that have the Euro will still allow a more than 50% reduction of uncontrolled EU immigration and yet maintain opportunities in the majority of Europe for UK citizens.

attributes.action: Require restaurants to specify menu items that are microwave meals
attributes.background:
I propose that restaurants should be required to inform customers on their menu whether a meal is microwaved or prepared fresh.

A large number of restaurants and pubs regularly include ready meals and microwave meals on their menu but are not required to inform customers.
attributes.additional_details:
Requiring restaurants to state this information would allow customers to make a more informed decision on what they're eating, as many people like myself would rather not include microwave meals in their diet, especially when paying a premium for eating it in a restaurant.

This change would hopefully lead customers to ordering freshly made meals, encouraging restaurants to change their practices and perhaps helping their unskilled staff gain kitchen qualifications to help further their careers.

attributes.action: Unite all 43 police forces in England and Wales into one National Police Force.
attributes.background: A lot of money can be saved by the ilmination of duplication and as far as the British public is concerned, apart from the accent the North Yorkshire force is the same as the Met.

attributes.action: Referendums must be clearly won AND not disenfranchise relevant constituents.
attributes.background:
Issues important enough to create referendums should not be won by a simple majority, a clear mandate is required.
Voter Turnout >75% wins with >60%,
Voter Turnout <50% wins with >75% with a sliding scale in between.
AND British Ex-Pats should not be excluded on international issues.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is only meant to affect future referendums including but not exclusive to a 2nd EU referendum.
Many on both sides of the recent campaign called for the argument to be clearly won, before and after the vote.  Uncertainty, resentment and protest vote factors could be minimized by more definitive results.
Also, more than 2 million British Ex-pats were denied the vote despite life changing implications for them and the intentions of the Queen’s Speech of May 2015 Votes For Life Bill.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for companies to disclose their phone number on contact.
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for companies to disclose their phone number when contacting people. This will give people the chance to call bar nuisance callers directly from home and hopefully bring a stop to the constantly ringing telephone and recorded messages.

attributes.action: Introduce better benefits for stay at home parents.
attributes.background: Child care is very expensive which means some parents decided to live off one wage and have a stay at home Mum or Dad for their child. I feel that there is not enough financial help from the government for stay at home parents.Sometimes the wage of one isn't enough.

attributes.action: We have no right to light. I think people should be entitled to light
attributes.background: I recently asked the local council to cut some trees that block daylight on my property and disabled neighbours nextdoor. I was advised I have no right to light and the law states this.

attributes.action: Change the way political parties are funded.
attributes.background: Political Parties should be funded from tax revenues only. There should be heavy financial penalties for Parties which renege on manifesto commitments; “fail to mention” major policies in their manifesto which they then implement.
attributes.additional_details: Such funding would help achieve a 'level playing field' for all parties and the removal of rich backers with vested interests and agendas. Financial penalties would help clean up campaigning prior to elections and restore a degree of trust in politicians and the system.

attributes.action: Provide bursaries for mental health training
attributes.background: Psychotherapy and counselling training is lengthy and expensive. Mental health is crying out for more trained professionals. I would like to see incentivised grants to help attract more people to the profession, and to help those attracted, but without the funds to study.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has a teacher shortage. As a result, the Government introduced incentivised bursaries to attract more people to train as teachers. The mental health profession has an even bigger shortage, yet training is both lengthy and very expensive. If we are to help deal with the deficit of appointments and patients on waiting lists, then access to training needs is a necessity.

Please support this important campaign to help provide more professionals in such an underresourced sector.

attributes.action: Stop the bidding and banding system for new council/housing associations
attributes.background: This is for a better housing allocations as the bidding and banding system does not work for a lot of people and are left living in a place there not happy and doesn't meet the needs for the family
attributes.additional_details: I have been living i n a poky 2 bed ground floor flat for 5years and is not suitable for us as my child has hardly any space and bidding does not get us any where something seriously need to change please sign this petition to get a chance to get what we all need and deserve

attributes.action: Declare Richmond park in London, car free Zone
attributes.background:
One of the very few places in London, where Londoners and visitors can enjoy, walking, cycling and generally being close to nature without having to leave London. 

The experience, however, is very much spoiled by increased risk of accidents due to huge number of cars driving around the park.
attributes.additional_details: Declare Richmond park in London, car free Zone. If this is not possible, the park should be car-free at the weekends.

attributes.action: Abolish Sunday trading laws.
attributes.background: Scotland has abolished them, so why can't we!

attributes.action: Child Maintenance Payments applied to a Card that is regularly reviewed.
attributes.background: Child Maintenance Visa Cards would ensure that the hard earned cash is being spent on the child and not the mother. Accounts should be reviewed every quarter and receipts should need to be submitted monthly to confirm what had been spent. A app that lets you scan the receipts would keep things easy.
attributes.additional_details: Fathers who pay child maintenance for children should be allowed to see that their hard earned money is actually being spent on supporting the child, instead it is seen as a position of power and a way to undermine the father, the idea is to provide mothers with a card that can be monitored to ensure the money is being spent correctly, for example say there's £300 on the card and only £100 is spent that month the £200 left over should be put into a savings account for the child's 18th birthday?

attributes.action: Allocate MPS seat in parliament according to their last name.
attributes.background: Placing those who represent us opposite each-other, in confrontation, creates a division that separates them and that they use as a fence, many times feeling comfortable attacking and shouting to each-other which would dramatically change if you allocate sitting in the house by alphabetical order.
attributes.additional_details:
Symbols, and orders have a strong impact in reality and in the way humans interact and relate to each other. A feasible way to start unifying this country is by simply making the members of parliament sit among members of the "opposition".  
That is how we, the people, that have given you this job, live and interact in society, and reflecting this in the house, would bring us a step closer to negotiate, to have compassion, to stop thinking of rivals and start thinking of building together.

attributes.action: Stop night time road closures which is costing haulage companies millions
attributes.background: Road closures during the night are costing lorry drivers millions in lost time and fuel. The diversions off of some motorways can add an hour on to a journey. It seems like the highways agency find it easier to close a road rather put a contaflow in place.
